identificationModule.briefTitle: Syringe Service Based Telemedicine and Social Network Driven HIV Prevention Service Implementation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Syringe Service Based Telemedicine and Social Network Driven HIV Prevention Service Implementation

collaborators.name: Maryland Department of Health and Mental Hygiene

armGroups.label: Peer-educator-based network intervention
armGroups.description: Indexes randomized to the intervention arm will complete a training program that emphasizes effective communication, frequent HIV testing, and awareness of evidence-based HIV prevention and treatment services. An important innovation to the network intervention will be training indexes to use and distribute HIV self-test kits and naloxone to their network members (NMs).

armGroups.label: Equal-attention control
armGroups.description: This group will receive training sessions that will be focused on the opioid overdose epidemic and will not include any training to serve as a peer educator.

interventions.name: Peer-educator-based network
interventions.description: The intervention is a social network-based method of dispersing HIV knowledge, HIV self-testing (HIVST) kits, and naloxone in social networks of people who inject drugs (PWID). It targets index participants (peers) to receive training on HIVST, peer education, and linkage to syringe service programs (SSPs) for HIV services.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of HIV testing for Network Members
primaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of Network Members (both study arms) who report that they conducted HIV testing since the previous study assessment (i.e., in the prior 3 or 6 months).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of HIV testing for Index and Network Members
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of Index and Network Members (both study arms) who report testing since the previous study assessment (i.e., in the prior 3 or 6 months).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of HIV testing for Index Members
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of Index Members (both study arms) who report testing since the previous study assessment (i.e., in the prior 3 or 6 months).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of HIV negative participants who have used PrEP uptake
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of HIV-negative participants who have used PrEP (yes/no) since the previous study assessment (i.e., in the prior 3 or 6 months) among Network Members.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Knowledge of PrEP options
secondaryOutcomes.description: Knowledge of PrEP options and resources measured by questionnaire at 3 and 9 months among Network Members.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants using anti-retroviral therapy (ART)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of participants living with HIV who reported they are currently using anti-retroviral therapy (ART), (yes/no) at the 3- or 9-month follow-up among Network Members.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants who have used Medication for opioid use disorder (MOUD) uptake
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of participants who report that they have used MOUD (yes/no) since the previous study assessment (i.e., in the prior 3 or 6 months) among Network Members.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Inclusion criteria for index participants:

* Aged 18 or older
* Self-reported injection drug use in the prior month
* Accessed services at the SSP in the prior 3 months
* Willing to undergo training and attend weekly booster group sessions
* Able to recruit at least 1 drug use Network Member (NM) into study
* Willing to talk with peers about PWID topics such as HIV prevention and care
* Not previously enrolled in the study as index or NM
* English-speaking

Inclusion criteria for network member participants:

* Aged 18 or older
* Self-reported injection drug use in the prior month
* Have a valid coupon or able to recall the 3-digit ID number
* Not previously enrolled in the study as index or NM
* English-speaking

Exclusion criteria:

• Individuals lacking the capacity to consent

browseBranches.name: Urinary Tract, Sexual Organs, and Pregnancy Conditions
